snippet.title: 16-year-old girl missing from Morayfield
snippet.content:
Police are appealing for public assistance to help locate a girl missing form Morayfield.
The 16-year-old was last seen at a home on Petersen Road in the afternoon of July 23.
She had remained in contact with family up until July 28, but they have not heard from her since.
Police and family are concerned for her welfare due to her age.
She is described as Caucasian in appearance, around 171 centimetres tall with long brown hair and blue eyes.
Anyone who may have seen her is urged to contact police.
If you have information for police, contact Policelink on 131 444 or provide information using the online form 24hrs per day. You can report information about crime anonymously to Crime Stoppers, a registered charity and community volunteer organisation, by calling 1800 333 000 or via crimestoppersqld.com.au 24hrs per day.
